subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 1176
msgSnippet: Ron Jeffries wrote:  ... Like the ones in Adventures in C#? :) Agreed. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com
messageBody:
Ron Jeffries wrote:
<snip />
> >> I resemble this remark, and it's hard to refute.
> >>
> >> I still don't have the necessary skill to do very well what Thomas
> rightly
> >> recommends, but I believe that he's right.
>
> > Separation is, however, a majority of the solution. It is easily 80% of
> > the solution, if not more. I hope that readers do not interpret your
> > remark to mean that separation is ineffective.
>
> Oh yes, I fully agree. It's very effective. It just leaves certain common
> kinds of holes.

Like the ones in Adventures in C#? :) Agreed.
